questions.question: Who can participate?
questions.answer: Any student in highschool, university, or college can attend!

questions.question: How much does it cost?
questions.answer: cuHacking 2020 is completely free! (We even cover the food)

questions.question: Will food be provided?
questions.answer: All your meals will be provided at the hackathon. Lunch, dinner will be provided on Saturday, and breakfast and lunch on Sunday. We will have snacks throughout the event.

questions.question: What if Iâ€™ve never been to a hackathon?
questions.answer: We accept a large amount of novice and first-time hackers. In 2019, over 50% of hackers attended cuHacking as their first hackathon. We will have mentors, workshops, and presentations to help you with your hack. Come ready to learn some awesome new skills and meet new people!

questions.question: Where is cuHacking 2020 taking place?
questions.answer: cuHacking 2020 will take place in [Richcraft Hall (RB)](https://carleton.ca/campus/map/#RB) at Carleton University in Ottawa, Ontario.

questions.question: How many people are on a team?
questions.answer: Teams can vary in size from 2-4 people. We recommend making a group of 4, and making new friends!

questions.question: Do I need a team beforehand?
questions.answer: You do not need to make a team beforehand. There will be an opportunity to meet people to work with during this event.

questions.question: Can I work on my project before the hackathon?
questions.answer: No. All projects must be made during the 24 hours of hacking at the event. You can learn the skills needed to work on the projects beforehand, but pre-existing projects are not allowed at cuHacking to maintain fairness between teams.

questions.question: Will you be sending buses?
questions.answer: We will be providing a bus for hackers in Toronto. More details to come about this and other locations.

questions.question: Is there travel reimbursement?
questions.answer: We may provide some travel reimbursement based on our funding. Stay tuned for more info.

questions.question: Where can I find parking?
questions.answer: There are many places to park over the weekend. Parking information can be found at [Carleton Parking Services](https://carleton.ca/parking/).

questions.question: Is the parking covered?
questions.answer:
Parking will not be covered for hackers by cuHacking. For Ottawa participants, we recommend taking a bus or the O-Train to campus. There are various free Park and Ride locations on the weekend that hackers can use.

If you would prefer to park on campus, information can be found [online](https://carleton.ca/parking/), parking is cheap on the weekends.
